mode_of_action: Transmembrane transporter exporting trehalose monomycolate (mycolic acid precursor) to the cell wall; blocking MmpL3 prevents mycolic acid layer assembly, leading to cell wall disruption and growth inhibition

Cytochrome b subunit of the bc<sub>1</sub>-aa<sub>3</sub> complex in respiration; QcrB inhibitors block electron transfer in the respiratory chain, collapsing the proton gradient and ATP synthesis, which is bactericidal even in non-replicating M. tb

Catalyzes attachment of leucine to tRNA<sup>Leu</sup> in protein synthesis; LeuRS inhibition causes accumulation of uncharged tRNA<sup>Leu</sup>, triggering translational arrest and bacterial death. An oxaborole inhibitor (GSK 070) targeting LeuRS has demonstrated potent anti-TB activity

Membrane phosphoribosyltransferase producing decaprenyl P–ribose (DPPR), a precursor for arabinan in cell-wall arabinogalactan; inhibiting Rv3806c would block arabinan synthesis, weakening the cell wall
MurT and GatD amidate D-glutamate in peptidoglycan precursors; loss of this amidation hinders peptide cross-linking and increases cell-wall permeability
MurT and GatD amidate D-glutamate in peptidoglycan precursors; loss of this amidation hinders peptide cross-linking and increases cell-wall permeability
Secreted class-A β-lactamase that hydrolyzes β-lactam antibiotics, inducing resistance
Purine salvage enzyme converting guanine/hypoxanthine to GMP/IMP; blocking HGPRT depletes nucleotide pools, impairing DNA/RNA synthesis and growth (especially under nutrient-limited conditions)
Phosphorylates dTMP to dTDP in thymidine nucleotide biosynthesis; inhibition causes a shortfall of dTTP for DNA replication, stalling cell division and leading to cell death
); blocking chorismate mutase (including secreted form) starves M. tb of aromatic amino acids and attenuates growth and persistence

Response regulator controlling the DosR regulon for dormancy adaptation under hypoxia (two-component system DosS/DosR); a DosR inhibitor would prevent activation of latent-phase genes, reducing M. tb’s ability to establish and maintain dormancy

Enables M. tb to utilize fatty acids and persist in macrophages; inhibition of ICL (e.g. by itaconate, a host metabolite) blocks the glyoxylate cycle, impairing in vivo survival and reducing virulence

Converts aspartate to β-alanine, a precursor for pantothenate (vitamin B5) and coenzyme A biosynthesis. Pyrazinamide’s active form binds and inactivates PanD, depleting CoA and curbing TB survival during latenc
Broad-spectrum r transporter that exports drugsInhibition of EfpA can increase intracellular drug retention, enhancing antibiotic efficacy
Key enzyme in mycolic acid synthesis; inhibition prevents mycolic acid formation in the cell wall, leading to cell death
DNA-dependent RNA polymerase subunit for transcription; rifamycins bind RpoB and block RNA elongation, halting RNA synthesis and killing the bacterium
Type II topoisomerase that supercoils DNA during replication/transcription; fluoroquinolone binding stalls the gyrase–DNA complex, causing lethal DNA breaks and replication arrest
Type II topoisomerase that supercoils DNA during replication/transcription; fluoroquinolone binding stalls the gyrase–DNA complex, causing lethal DNA breaks and replication arrest
FoF1 ATP synthase generates ATP via proton motive force; bedaquiline binds the c-subunit and blocks rotary ATP synthesis, depleting energy reserves and killing M. tb
Glycosyltransferase of the EmbCAB complex that polymerizes arabinose into arabinogalactan; ethambutol inhibits arabinan chain elongation in the cell wall, weakening cell envelope integrity

Pyridoxal enzyme that converts L-Ala to D-Ala for peptidoglycan crosslinking; cycloserine irreversibly inhibits Alr (and D-Ala–D-Ala ligase), depleting D-Ala and preventing cell wall crosslink formation, leading to bacterial lysis
Needed for ribosomal rescue under stress conditions
Flavin enzyme that converts DPR to DPA in arabinogalactan precursor biosynthesis; inhibition disrupts arabinan synthesis, compromising cell wall integrity and causing cell death
FAS-II condensing enzyme elongating fatty-acyl chains for mycolic acids; inhibition halts long-chain mycolic acid synthesis, disrupting cell wall biosynthesis
Activates long-chain fatty acids (meromycolate) as acyl-adenylates for transfer to Pks13 in mycolic acid biosynthesis; inhibition of FadD32 blocks mycolic acid production
blocking Pks13 prevents synthesis of full-length mycolic acids
Alternate NADH. inhibition of NDH-2 blocks electron flow and can provoke buildup of NADH and reactive intermediates, impairing energy metabolism
Transfers 4′-phosphopantetheine from CoA to acyl-carrier proteins (activating PKS and NRPS enzymes); PptT is essential for producing mycolic acids and siderophores

AAA+ ATPase that powers the ClpP1P2 protease, unfolding targeted proteins for degradation. ClpC1 inhibitors (cyclic peptides) either lock ClpC1 or hyperactivate ClpP, leading to accumulation of toxic proteins or increase proteolysis

αβ enzyme complex that synthesizes L-tryptophan from indole and serine; an allosteric inhibitor (BRD-4592) binding the TrpAB interface prevents tryptophan production M. tb cannot acquire sufficient Trp from the host, so TrpAB inhibition starves the bacillus of an essential amino acid

αβ enzyme complex that synthesizes L-tryptophan from indole and serine; an allosteric inhibitor (BRD-4592) binding the TrpAB interface prevents tryptophan production M. tb cannot acquire sufficient Trp from the host, so TrpAB inhibition starves the bacillus of an essential amino acid
Blocking MenA collapses the electron transport chain by preventing menaquinone production, which is highly bactericidal even against non-replicating M. tb
